description: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes
comments:
It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left.
As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}%)

description: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.WARN:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}%)

description: HAProxy frontend {#PXNAME}: Session utilization is high
comments: Alerting on this metric is essential to ensure your server has sufficient capacity to handle all concurrent sessions. Unlike requests, upon reaching the session limit HAProxy will deny additional clients until resource consumption drops. Furthermore, if you find your session usage percentage to be hovering above 80%, it could be time to either modify HAProxy's configuration to allow more sessions, or migrate your HAProxy server to a bigger box.

description: ES {#ES.NODE}: Flush latency is too high
comments:
If you see this metric increasing steadily, it may indicate a problem with slow disks; this problem may escalate
and eventually prevent you from being able to add new information to your index.
event_name: ES {#ES.NODE}: Flush latency is too high (over {$ELASTICSEARCH.FLUSH_LATENCY.MAX.WARN}ms for 5m)

description: ES {#ES.NODE}: Indexing latency is too high
comments:
If the latency is increasing, it may indicate that you are indexing too many documents at the same time (Elasticsearch's documentation
recommends starting with a bulk indexing size of 5 to 15 megabytes and increasing slowly from there).
event_name: ES {#ES.NODE}: Indexing latency is too high (over {$ELASTICSEARCH.INDEXING_LATENCY.MAX.WARN}ms for 5m)

description: ES {#ES.NODE}: Fetch latency is too high
comments:
The fetch phase should typically take much less time than the query phase. If you notice this metric consistently increasing,
this could indicate a problem with slow disks, enriching of documents (highlighting the relevant text in search results, etc.),
or requesting too many results.
event_name: ES {#ES.NODE}: Fetch latency is too high (over {$ELASTICSEARCH.FETCH_LATENCY.MAX.WARN}ms for 5m)

description: ES {#ES.NODE}: Query latency is too high
comments: If latency exceeds a threshold, look for potential resource bottlenecks, or investigate whether you need to optimize your queries.
event_name: ES {#ES.NODE}: Query latency is too high (over {$ELASTICSEARCH.QUERY_LATENCY.MAX.WARN}ms for 5m)

description: ES {#ES.NODE}: Percent of JVM heap in use is high
comments:
This indicates that the rate of garbage collection isn't keeping up with the rate of garbage creation.
To address this problem, you can either increase your heap size (as long as it remains below the recommended
guidelines stated above), or scale out the cluster by adding more nodes.
event_name: ES {#ES.NODE}: Percent of JVM heap in use is high (over {$ELASTICSEARCH.HEAP_USED.MAX.WARN}% for 1h)

description: ES {#ES.NODE}: Percent of JVM heap in use is critical
comments:
This indicates that the rate of garbage collection isn't keeping up with the rate of garbage creation.
To address this problem, you can either increase your heap size (as long as it remains below the recommended
guidelines stated above), or scale out the cluster by adding more nodes.
event_name: ES {#ES.NODE}: Percent of JVM heap in use is critical (over {$ELASTICSEARCH.HEAP_USED.MAX.CRIT}% for 1h)

description: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

comments:

1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

description: MSSQL AG '{#GROUP_NAME}': Primary replica recovery health in progress
comments: The primary replica is in the synchronization process.

description: MSSQL AG '{#GROUP_NAME}': Secondary replica recovery health in progress
comments: The secondary replica is in the synchronization process.

description: MSSQL AG '{#GROUP_NAME}': All replicas unhealthy
comments: None of the availability replicas have a healthy synchronization.

description: MSSQL AG '{#GROUP_NAME}': Some replicas unhealthy
comments: The synchronization health of some, but not all, availability replicas is healthy.

description: MSSQL DB '{#DBNAME}': Total wait time to flush the log is high
comments: The wait time to flush the log is too long.
event_name: MSSQL DB '{#DBNAME}': Total wait time to flush the log is high (over {$MSSQL.LOG_FLUSH_WAIT_TIME.MAX:"{#DBNAME}"}ms for 5m)

description: MSSQL DB '{#DBNAME}': Number of commits waiting for the log flush is high
comments: Too many commits are waiting for the log flush.
event_name: MSSQL DB '{#DBNAME}': Number of commits waiting for the log flush is high (over {$MSSQL.LOG_FLUSH_WAITS.MAX:"{#DBNAME}"}/sec for 5m)

description: MSSQL DB '{#DBNAME}': Percent of log using is high
comments: There's not enough space left in the log.
event_name: MSSQL DB '{#DBNAME}': Percent of log using is high (over {$MSSQL.PERCENT_LOG_USED.MAX:"{#DBNAME}"}% for 5m)

description: MSSQL DB '{#DBNAME}': State is {ITEM.VALUE}
comments: The DB has a non-working state.

description: MSSQL AG '{#GROUP_NAME}' Local DB '{#DBNAME}': "{#DBNAME}" is {ITEM.VALUE}
comments: The local availability database has a non-working state.

description: MSSQL AG '{#GROUP_NAME}' Local DB '{#DBNAME}': "{#DBNAME}" is Not healthy
comments: The synchronization state of the local availability database is NOT SYNCHRONIZING.

description: MSSQL AG '{#GROUP_NAME}' Local DB '{#DBNAME}': "{#DBNAME}" is Partially healthy
comments: A database on a synchronous-commit availability replica is considered partially healthy if synchronization state is SYNCHRONIZING.

description: MSSQL Mirroring '{#DBNAME}': "{#DBNAME}" is {ITEM.VALUE}
comments: The state of the mirror database and of the database mirroring session is "Suspended", "Disconnected from the other partner", or "Synchronizing".

description: MSSQL Mirroring '{#DBNAME}': "{#DBNAME}" is {ITEM.VALUE}
comments: The state of the mirror database and of the database mirroring session is "Pending Failover".

description: MSSQL Mirroring '{#DBNAME}': "{#DBNAME}" is {ITEM.VALUE}
comments: The state of the mirror database and of the database mirroring session is "Not synchronized". The partners are not synchronized. A failover is not possible now.

description: MSSQL Mirroring '{#DBNAME}': "{#DBNAME}" Witness is disconnected
comments: The state of the witness in the database mirroring session of the database is "Disconnected".

description: MSSQL AG '{#GROUP_NAME}' Replica '{#REPLICA_NAME}': {#REPLICA_NAME} is disconnected
comments:
The response of an availability replica to the DISCONNECTED state depends on its role:
On the primary replica, if a secondary replica is disconnected, its secondary databases are marked as NOT SYNCHRONIZED on the primary replica, which waits for the secondary to reconnect; On a secondary replica, upon detecting that it is disconnected, the secondary replica attempts to reconnect to the primary replica.

description: MSSQL AG '{#GROUP_NAME}' Replica '{#REPLICA_NAME}': {#REPLICA_NAME} is {ITEM.VALUE}
comments: The operational state of the replica in a given availability group is "Pending" or "Offline".

description: MSSQL AG '{#GROUP_NAME}' Replica '{#REPLICA_NAME}': {#REPLICA_NAME} is {ITEM.VALUE}
comments: The operational state of the replica in a given availability group is "Failed".

description: MSSQL AG '{#GROUP_NAME}' Replica '{#REPLICA_NAME}': {#REPLICA_NAME} is {ITEM.VALUE}
comments: The operational state of the replica in a given availability group is "Failed, no quorum".

description: MSSQL AG '{#GROUP_NAME}' Replica '{#REPLICA_NAME}': {#REPLICA_NAME} Recovery in progress
comments: At least one joined database has a database state other than ONLINE.

description: MSSQL AG '{#GROUP_NAME}' Replica '{#REPLICA_NAME}': {#REPLICA_NAME} is Not healthy
comments: At least one joined database is in the NOT SYNCHRONIZING state.

description: MSSQL AG '{#GROUP_NAME}' Replica '{#REPLICA_NAME}': {#REPLICA_NAME} is Partially healthy
comments: Some replicas are not in the target synchronization state: synchronous-commit replicas should be synchronized, and asynchronous-commit replicas should be synchronizing.

description: DB {#DBNAME}: Too many recovery conflicts
comments:
The primary and standby servers are in many ways loosely connected. Actions on the primary will have an effect on the standby. As a result, there is potential for negative interactions or conflicts between them.
https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/hot-standby.html#HOT-STANDBY-CONFLICT

description: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:\"{#IFNAME}\"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important.
    No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status is different from Connected(2).

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

description: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes
comments:
It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left.
As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes
comments:
It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left.
As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: Node {#NODE.NAME}: Node cannot takeover it's HA partner {#PARTNER.NAME}. Reason: {ITEM.VALUE}
comments:
Possible reasons:
  unknownReason(2),
  disabledByOperator(3),
  interconnectOffline(4),
  disabledByPartner(5),
  takeoverFailed(6),
  mailboxIsInDegradedState(7),
  partnermailboxIsInUninitialisedState(8),
  mailboxVersionMismatch(9),
  nvramSizeMismatch(10),
  kernelVersionMismatch(11),
  partnerIsInBootingStage(12),
  diskshelfIsTooHot(13),
  partnerIsPerformingRevert(14),
  nodeIsPerformingRevert(15),
  sametimePartnerIsAlsoTryingToTakeUsOver(16),
  alreadyInTakenoverMode(17),
  nvramLogUnsynchronized(18),
  stateofBackupMailboxIsDoubtful(19).

When the number of available read tickets remaining reaches zero, new read requests will be queued until a new read ticket is available."

description: MongoDB: Available WiredTiger write tickets is low

When the number of available write tickets remaining reaches zero, new write requests will be queued until a new write ticket is available."

comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

description: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: {#ID}: Chassis has something errors
comments: Something is wrong with the chassis.

description: {#DISKNAME}: Disk of the Node "{#NODENAME}" has state different from "present"
comments: Something is wrong with the disk.

description: {#FRUID}: FRU of the chassis "{#ID}" state is error
comments: Something is wrong with the FRU.

description: {#LUNNAME}: LUN of the SVM "{#SVMNAME}" has abnormal container state
comments: LUNs are only available when their containers are available.

description: {#LUNNAME}: LUN of the SVM "{#SVMNAME}" has abnormal state
comments: Normal states for a LUN are online and offline. Other states indicate errors.

description: {#NODENAME}: Version has changed
comments: {#NODENAME} version has changed. Ack to close.
event_name: {#NODENAME}: Version has changed (new version: {ITEM.VALUE})

description: {#NODENAME}: Node has over temperature
comments: The hardware shuts down if the temperature exceeds critical thresholds(item's value is "over").

description: {#NODENAME}: Node state is abnormal
comments:
The state of the node is different from up:
booting - Node is booting up.
down - Node has stopped or is dumping core.
taken_over - Node has been taken over by its HA partner and is not yet waiting for giveback.
waiting_for_giveback - Node has been taken over by its HA partner and is waiting for the HA partner to giveback disks.
degraded - Node has one or more critical services offline.
unknown - Node or its HA partner cannot be contacted and there is no information on the node's state.

description: {#NODENAME}: Node has been restarted
comments: Uptime is less than 10 minutes
event_name: {#NODENAME}: Node has been restarted (uptime < 10m)

description: {#ETHPORTNAME}: Ethernet port of the Node "{#NODENAME}" is down
comments: Something is wrong with the ethernet port.

description: {#FCPORTNAME}: FC port of the Node "{#NODENAME}" has state different from "online"
comments: Something is wrong with the FC port.

description: {#SVMNAME}: SVM state is abnormal
comments: Something is wrong with the SVM.

description: {#VOLUMENAME}: Volume state is abnormal
comments: A volume can only be brought online if it is offline. Taking a volume offline removes its junction path. The 'mixed' state applies to FlexGroup volumes only and cannot be specified as a target state. An 'error' state implies that the volume is not in a state to serve data.

description: Broker {#JMXBROKERNAME}: Message enqueue rate is higher than dequeue rate
comments: Enqueue rate is higher than dequeue rate. It may indicate performance problems.
event_name: Broker {#JMXBROKERNAME}: Message enqueue rate is higher than dequeue rate for {$ACTIVEMQ.MSG.RATE.WARN.TIME:"{#JMXBROKERNAME}"}

description: {#JMXBROKERNAME}: {#JMXDESTINATIONTYPE} {#JMXDESTINATIONNAME}: Message enqueue rate is higher than dequeue rate
comments: Enqueue rate is higher than dequeue rate. It may indicate performance problems.
event_name: {#JMXBROKERNAME}: {#JMXDESTINATIONTYPE} {#JMXDESTINATIONNAME}: Message enqueue rate is higher than dequeue rate for {$ACTIVEMQ.MSG.RATE.WARN.TIME:"{#JMXDESTINATIONNAME}"}

description: {#JMXBROKERNAME}: {#JMXDESTINATIONTYPE} {#JMXDESTINATIONNAME}: Expired messages count is high
comments: This metric represents the number of messages that expired before they could be delivered. If you expect all messages to be delivered and acknowledged within a certain amount of time, you can set an expiration for each message, and investigate if your ExpiredCount metric rises above zero.
event_name: {#JMXBROKERNAME}: {#JMXDESTINATIONTYPE} {#JMXDESTINATIONNAME}: Expired messages count higher than {$ACTIVEMQ.EXPIRED.WARN:"{#JMXDESTINATIONNAME}"}

description: {#JMXBROKERNAME}: {#JMXDESTINATIONTYPE} {#JMXDESTINATIONNAME}: Queue size is high
comments: Queue size is higher than threshold. It may indicate performance problems.
event_name: {#JMXBROKERNAME}: {#JMXDESTINATIONTYPE} {#JMXDESTINATIONNAME}: Queue size higher than {$ACTIVEMQ.QUEUE.WARN:"{#JMXDESTINATIONNAME}"} for {$ACTIVEMQ.QUEUE.TIME:"{#JMXDESTINATIONNAME}"}

description: TiDB cluster: Current storage usage is too high
comments: Over {$PD.STORAGE_USAGE.MAX.WARN}% of the cluster space is occupied.
event_name: TiDB cluster: Current storage usage is too high (over {$PD.STORAGE_USAGE.MAX.WARN}% for 5m)

description: TiDB cluster: There are disconnected TiKV nodes
comments: PD does not receive a TiKV heartbeat within 20 seconds. Normally a TiKV heartbeat comes in every 10 seconds.

description: TiDB cluster: There are offline TiKV nodes
comments: PD has not received a TiKV heartbeat for a long time.

description: TiDB cluster: There are low space TiKV nodes
comments: Indicates that there is no sufficient space on the TiKV node.

description: TiDB cluster: There are unresponsive peers
comments: The number of Regions with an unresponsive peer reported by the Raft leader.

description: TiDB cluster: Too many missed regions
comments: The number of Region replicas is smaller than the value of max-replicas. When a TiKV machine is down and its downtime exceeds max-down-time, it usually leads to missing replicas for some Regions during a period of time. When a TiKV node is made offline, it might result in a small number of Regions with missing replicas.
event_name: TiDB cluster: Too many missed regions (over {$PD.MISS_REGION.MAX.WARN} in 5m)

description: TiDB: Too many failed GC-related operations
event_name: TiDB: Too many failed GC-related operations (over {$TIDB.GC_ACTIONS.ERRORS.MAX.WARN} in 5m)

description: TiKV: Store_id {#STORE_ID}: Too many failure messages "{#TYPE}"
comments: Indicates that the remote TiKV cannot be connected.
event_name: TiKV: Store_id {#STORE_ID}: Too many failure messages "{#TYPE}" (over {$TIKV.STORE.ERRORS.MAX.WARN} in 5m)

description: Cisco ASAv: {#CISCO.IF.NAME} Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. Condition of difference between last and previous value - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

description: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}%)

description: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}%)

description: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}%)

description: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is low

description: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}%)

description: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is low

description: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}%)

description: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is low
comments:

event_name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}"}%)

comments: High availability state is "FAILED".

comments: Edge state is "OFFLINE".

comments: Edge was restarted.
event_name: Edge [{#NAME}]: Edge has been restarted (uptime < 10m)

comments: The number of connected edges is changed.

comments: Gateway was restarted.
event_name: Gateway [{#NAME}]: Gateway has been restarted (uptime < 10m)

comments: Link state is not "STABLE".

comments: The state of the node has changed. Confirm to close.

comments: The state of the node has changed. Confirm to close.

event_name: Node [{#NAME}] Limits: Total CPU limits are too high (more than 90% of allocatable)

description: Node [{#NAME}] Limits: Total CPU limits are too high
event_name: Node [{#NAME}] Limits: Total CPU limits are too high (more than 100% of allocatable)

event_name: Node [{#NAME}] Limits: Total memory limits are too high (more than 90% of allocatable)

description: Node [{#NAME}] Limits: Total memory limits are too high
event_name: Node [{#NAME}] Limits: Total memory limits are too high (more than 100% of allocatable)

event_name: Node [{#NAME}] Requests: Total CPU requests are too high (more than 50% of allocatable)

event_name: Node [{#NAME}] Requests: Total CPU requests are too high (more than 80% of allocatable)

description: Node [{#NAME}] Requests: Total memory requests are too high
event_name: Node [{#NAME}] Requests: Total memory requests are too high (more than 50% of allocatable)

description: Node [{#NAME}] Requests: Total memory requests are too high
event_name: Node [{#NAME}] Requests: Total memory requests are too high (more than 80% of allocatable)

description: Node [{#NAME}] Used: Kubelet too many pods
comments: Kubelet is running at capacity.
event_name: Node [{#NAME}] Used: Kubelet too many pods (more than 95% of capacity)

description: Node [{#NAME}] Conditions: Pressure exists on the disk size
comments: True - pressure exists on the disk size - that is, if the disk capacity is low; otherwise False.
event_name: Node [{#NAME}] Conditions: Pressure exists on the disk size (state: {ITEM.VALUE})

description: Node [{#NAME}] Conditions: Pressure exists on the node memory
comments: True - pressure exists on the node memory - that is, if the node memory is low; otherwise False
event_name: Node [{#NAME}] Conditions: Pressure exists on the node memory (state: {ITEM.VALUE})

description: Node [{#NAME}] Conditions: Network is not correctly configured
comments: True - the network for the node is not correctly configured, otherwise False
event_name: Node [{#NAME}] Conditions: Network is not correctly configured (state: {ITEM.VALUE})

description: Node [{#NAME}] Conditions: Pressure exists on the processes
comments: True - pressure exists on the processes - that is, if there are too many processes on the node; otherwise False
event_name: Node [{#NAME}] Conditions: Pressure exists on the processes (state: {ITEM.VALUE})

description: Node [{#NAME}] Conditions: Is not in Ready state
comments:
False - if the node is not healthy and is not accepting pods.
Unknown - if the node controller has not heard from the node in the last node-monitor-grace-period (default is 40 seconds).
event_name: Node [{#NAME}] Conditions: Is not in Ready state (state: {ITEM.VALUE})

description: Node [{#NAME}]: Has been restarted
comments: Uptime is less than 10 minutes
event_name: Node [{#NAME}]: Has been restarted (uptime < 10m)

description: Node [{#NODE}] Pod [{#POD}]: Pod is crash looping
comments: Pos restarts more than 2 times in the last 3 minutes.

description: Node [{#NODE}] Pod [{#POD}] Status: Kubernetes Pod not healthy
comments: Pod has been in a non-ready state for longer than 10 minutes.

description: Kubernetes: Component [{#NAME}] is unhealthy
Kubernetes: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Deployment [{#NAME}]: Deployment replicas mismatch
Kubernetes: Livez [{#NAME}] is unhealthy
Kubernetes: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Pod is not healthy
Kubernetes: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] Pod [{#NAME}]: Pod is crash looping
Kubernetes: NS [{#NAMESPACE}] PVC [{#NAME}]: PVC is pending
Kubernetes: Readyz [{#NAME}] is unhealthy
Kubernetes: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] RS [{#NAME}]: ReplicasSet mismatch
Kubernetes: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] RS [{#NAME}]: Statefulset replicas mismatch
Kubernetes: Namespace [{#NAMESPACE}] StatefulSet [{#NAME}]: StatfulSet is down
PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
comments: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

description: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High inbound bandwidth usage
comments: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.
event_name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High inbound bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )

description: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High outbound bandwidth usage
comments: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.
event_name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High outbound bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )

description: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High input error rate
comments: Recovers when below 80% of {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} threshold.
event_name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High input error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

description: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High output error rate
comments: Recovers when below 80% of {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} threshold.
event_name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High output error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

description: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.

event_name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage (>{$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}%)

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate
comments: Recovers when below 80% of {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} threshold
event_name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate (>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage
comments: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.
event_name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage (>{$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}%)

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate
comments: Recovers when below 80% of {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} threshold
event_name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate (>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

event_name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate (>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
comments: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

event_name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate (>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

description: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read/write request responses are too high
comments: This trigger might indicate disk {#DEVNAME} saturation.
event_name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read/write request responses are too high (read > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 15m or write > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 15m)

description: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes
comments:
It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left.
As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

description: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is quarantined critical
comments: The disk group is critical with at least one inaccessible disk. For example, two disks are inaccessible in a RAID 6 disk group or one disk is inaccessible for other fault-tolerant RAID levels. If the inaccessible disks come online or if after 60 seconds from being quarantined the disk group is QTCRor QTDN, the disk group is automatically dequarantined.

description: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is quarantined offline
comments: The disk group is offline with multiple inaccessible disks causing user data to be incomplete, or is an NRAID or RAID 0 disk group.

description: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is quarantined unsupported
comments: The disk group contains data in a format that is not supported by this system. For example, this system does not support linear disk groups.

description: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is quarantined with an inaccessible disk
comments: The RAID6 disk group has one inaccessible disk. The disk group is fault tolerant but degraded. If the inaccessible disks come online or if after 60 seconds from being quarantined the disk group is QTCRor QTDN, the disk group is automatically dequarantined.

comments: The disk group is online and fault tolerant, but some of it's disks are down.

description: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is offline
comments: Either the disk group is using offline initialization, or it's disks are down and data may be lost.

description: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is quarantined critical
comments: The disk group is critical with at least one inaccessible disk. For example, two disks are inaccessible in a RAID 6 disk group or one disk is inaccessible for other fault-tolerant RAID levels. If the inaccessible disks come online or if after 60 seconds from being quarantined the disk group is QTCRor QTDN, the disk group is automatically dequarantined.

description: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is quarantined offline
comments: The disk group is offline with multiple inaccessible disks causing user data to be incomplete, or is an NRAID or RAID 0 disk group.

description: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is quarantined unsupported
comments: The disk group contains data in a format that is not supported by this system. For example, this system does not support linear disk groups.

description: Disk group [{#NAME}]: Disk group is quarantined with an inaccessible disk
comments: The RAID6 disk group has one inaccessible disk. The disk group is fault tolerant but degraded. If the inaccessible disks come online or if after 60 seconds from being quarantined the disk group is QTCRor QTDN, the disk group is automatically dequarantined.

comments: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.
event_name: OPNsense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High inbound bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )

comments: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

description: OPNsense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High input error rate
comments: Recovers when below 80% of {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} threshold.
event_name: OPNsense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High input error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

description: OPNsense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High output error rate
comments: Recovers when below 80% of {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} threshold.
event_name: OPNsense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High output error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

description: OPNsense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}: High error rate
comments: Recovers when below 80% of {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} threshold
event_name: Interface {#IFNAME}: High error rate (>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

description: Interface {#IFNAME}: High bandwidth usage
comments: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.
event_name: Interface {#IFNAME}: High bandwidth usage (>{$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}%)

description: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}: Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
comments: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

description: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read/write request responses are too high
comments: This trigger might indicate disk {#DEVNAME} saturation.
event_name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read/write request responses are too high (read > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 15m or write > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 15m)

description: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes
comments:
It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left.
As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes
comments:
It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left.
As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.
event_name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)

description: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate (>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)
comments: Recovers when below 80% of {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} threshold

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage (>{$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}%)
comments: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
comments: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
comments: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:\"{#IFNAME}\"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important.
    No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status is different from Connected(2).

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

description: {#DEVNAME}: Disk is overloaded (util > {$VFS.DEV.UTIL.MAX.WARN}% for 15m)
comments: The disk appears to be under heavy load

description: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read request responses are too high (read > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"}s for 15m
comments: This trigger might indicate disk {#DEVNAME} saturation.

description: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write request responses are too high (write > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"}s for 15m)
comments: This trigger might indicate disk {#DEVNAME} saturation.

description: {#FSLABEL}({#FSNAME}): Disk space is critically. Space free {ITEM.LASTVALUE4} > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than 10G.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

description: {#FSLABEL}({#FSNAME}): Disk space is critically. Space free {ITEM.LASTVALUE4} > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than 10G.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:\"{#IFNAME}\"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important.
    No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status is different from Connected(2).

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than 5G.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate (>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)
comments: Recovers when below 80% of {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} threshold

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage (>{$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}%)
comments: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
comments: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

description: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:\"{#IFNAME}\"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important.
    No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status is different from Connected(2).

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

description: {#FSLABEL}({#FSNAME}): Disk space is critically. Space free {ITEM.LASTVALUE4} > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%
comments:

 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

description: {#FSLABEL}({#FSNAME}): Disk space is critically. Space free {ITEM.LASTVALUE4} > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%
comments:
Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}.
 Second condition should be one of the following:
 - The disk free space is less than 10G.
 - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

description: Port {#PORTA} is down
Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
comments:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.
